DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To compare effect protective versus conventional ventilatory strategy , systemic lung production tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( TNF-alpha ) interleukin-8 ( IL-8 ) patient without lung disease . Hypothesis : High tidal volume induce inflammation patient without lung disease Design : Prospective control-randomized study . Patients Setting : Twenty patient without lung disease submit mechanical ventilation admit one trauma one general adult intensive care unit two different university hospital . Interventions : Patients randomize receive mechanical ventilation either tidal volume ( VT ) 10-12 ml/kg predict body weight ( high VT group ) VT 5-7 ml/kg predict body weight ( low VT group ) O2 inspiratory fraction ( FIO2 ) enough keep arterial oxygen saturation > 90 % positive end-expiratory pressure ( PEEP ) 5 cmH2O 12 hour admission study .
DOC.brief_title: High Tidal Volume Induces Inflammation In Normal Lungs
DOC.criteria: 1. age ≥ 16 year ; 2. anticipate survival > 24 hour ; 3. need mechanical ventilation least 12 hour 4. hemodynamic stability ( MAP > 65 mmHg , HR < 100 beats/min , diuresis > 1 ml/kg/h , catecholamine requirement fluid challenge ) . 1. history lung disease , use immunosuppressive medication , recent infection , previous thromboembolic disease , recent ventilatory support , participation another clinical trial . Absence lung disease define follow clinical criterion : ( ) evidence respiratory infection ( white blood cell count < 10x103/µl , temperature > 380C , purulent sputum ) , ( b ) normal chest roentgenogram , ( c ) PaO2/FIO2 ratio > 300 , ( ) normal clinical respiratory history .
